isis.stitle: BRAKE COMPONENTS: This Service Manual Section should be used for reference only. For more current service information on all components go to the Bendix website from the ISIS Suppliers menu and refer to the Service Data Sheets. - BENDIX E6-TREADLE AND E7-SUSPENDED PEDAL TYPE (FOOT) BRAKE VALVES - SERVICING SUSPENDED TYPE VALVE

step1.para: Apply parking brake and block wheels.

note.para: On some models, it may be necessary to remove the coolant reservoir tank to have access to the valve air lines and mounting bolts, or the air filter assembly may have to be removed.

step1.para: Remove the strap securing the wiring harness to the coolant reservoir or air filter assembly.
Drain coolant reservoir if applicable.
Remove bolts/nuts securing coolant reservoir or air filter to mounting bracket.
Mark air lines (hoses) in relation to (foot) brake valve.
Disconnect all lines (hoses) connected to the valve.
Remove bolts securing valve from exterior side of dash panel. Remove valve.

svcsubproc.title: Disassemble
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 26 for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove three capscrews and pedal assembly.
Apply force on retainer, disengage locking tabs from body and remove retainer (Item 11).
Grasp lock nut (Item 13) of lower static piston assembly (Item 8) with pliers and pull piston assembly from body (Item 6).

Fabricate a hook from a 6 inch (152 mm) piece of 1/8 inch (3 mm) diameter wire (approx.), bending one end 90 degrees at a length 1/2 inch to 3/4 inch (12.7 to 19 mm) from end of wire. Insert hook end in bore of body and through secondary inlet valve exhaust bore hooking onto valve. Pull firmly and remove upper static piston (Item 3) assembly with secondary inlet and exhaust valve (Item 2).

Apply firm pressure on spring seat (Item 12) which will compress primary piston spring (Item 9). Locking groove (Item 18) in piston is now accessible through rectangular opening in body. Insert wire on screwdriver into locking groove, thus holding primary piston spring in compressed position.
Insert blade of screwdriver through exhaust passage of secondary and primary pistons (Item 10) and into slot of stem (Item 17). Back off locking nut (Item 13).
Remove locking nut (Item 13), spring stem guide (Item 14) and stem spring (Item 15).
Remove spring seat nut (Item 16), spring seat (Item 12) and rubber spring (Item 9).
Removal of screwdriver or wire from locking groove will permit spring load to push out primary piston (Item 10) and relay piston (Item 5).

warning.para: Care should be used when removing tool from locking ring because of spring load.

step1.para: Remove primary piston (Item 10) and return spring, and then relay piston (Item 5) and return spring.
Remove stem (Item 17) and O-rings from relay and primary pistons.
Remove O-rings from upper static piston (Item 3) and lower static piston (Item 8).

Remove large retaining ring from lower static piston (Item 8) and remove primary inlet/exhaust valve assembly (Item 19). Disassembly of inlet and exhaust valve is not required since it is only serviced as an assembly.
Remove large retaining ring from upper static piston assembly (Item 3) and remove secondary inlet/exhaust valve assembly (Item 2).

svcsubproc.title: Clean and Inspect
svcsubproc.para: Wash all metal parts in cleaning solvent. Use compressed air to dry parts. Inspect all parts for excessive wear or deterioration. Inspect valve seats for nicks or burrs. Check springs for cracks or corrosion. Replace all rubber parts and any part not considered to be serviceable.

svcsubproc.title: Reassemble
svcsubproc.para: Refer to Figure 26 for all items in parentheses.

Prior to reassembling brake valve, lubricate all O-rings, O-ring grooves, piston bores and metal-to-metal moving surfaces. Lubricate with Fleetrite EP2 Moly grease or equivalent to NLGI #2 multi-purpose lithium grease.

step1.para: Install new secondary inlet/exhaust valve assembly (Item 2) in upper static piston (Item 3) and secure with retaining ring (Item 1) making certain retaining ring is engaged in groove of upper static piston bore.
Install O-ring on upper static piston assembly (Item 3) and install in body of valve.

Install primary inlet/exhaust valve assembly (Item 19) in lower static piston (Item 8) and secure with retaining ring (Item 20) making certain retaining ring is engaged in groove in lower static piston (Item 8).
Install three O-rings in grooves of lower static piston assembly (Item 8).
The larger diameter O-ring is installed in groove nearest to bottom of piston assembly.
Install O-rings on relay piston (Item 5) and primary piston (Item 10).
Position rubber spring (Item 9), concave side down, in primary piston (Item 10) and place spring seat (Item 12), flat side up, over rubber spring.
Install spring seat nut (Item 16) on primary piston (Item 10) with hex head closest to spring seat and rotate nut clockwise until top surface of spring seat is even with top surface of piston.

Position relay piston spring, which is the lighter of the two piston return springs, relay piston (Item 5), primary piston spring and primary piston (Item 10) in lower static piston (Item 8). Compress both primary and secondary pistons in lower static piston. Hold them manually or mechanically.

note.para: A screwdriver may be used by inserting it through a rectangular opening in static piston into locking groove (Item 18) in primary piston (Item 10).

step1.para: Insert stem (Item 17) through exhaust passage of relay (Item 5) and primary pistons (Item 10) and engage a screwdriver with slot in head of stem; then position stem spring (Item 15), spring guide (Item 14) on spring seat nut (Item 16).
Compress guide spring assembly and install lock nut (Item 13) on stem. Tighten nut to 20 to 30 in-lbs. (2.3 to 3.4 N• m).

note.para: Torque is a specified value for assembly; after assembly, torque value will fall off. Do not retighten nut.

step1.para: Remove screwdriver from lower static piston assembly (Item 8).
Install lower static piston assembly (Item 8) in valve body. Then install retainer (Item 11) making certain locking tabs engage on valve body bosses.

Install pedal assembly using three capscrews. Check to be certain plunger is in contact with spring seat. The stop button should be adjusted so that the roller and plunger contact after adjustment; roller should be able to be turned freely by thumb.

Test rebuilt brake valve by performing
SERVICE CHECKS
.
